reviewText: I am partial to old cowboy movies. I like John Wayne flicks. Monte Walsh, on the other hand, is a story about what occurs in the lives of ordinary people when the basic conditions of their lifestyle change, and not always for the better.

Monte Walsh with Lee Marvin is a most poignant Western.  Lee Marvin was a hero on Guadalcanal and his combat veteran status makes the portrayal of the 'veteran' cowboy Monte Walsh even better.

Like most older Westerns, Rio Lobo is melodramatic though I still enjoy watching it.  However, I prefer John Wayne's later Westerns like Rio Bravo and El Dorado.
MY dad loves westerns...2 of my dad's favorite
Both movies are OK, Monte Walsh is better than Rio Lobo. I like the Tom Seleck version of Mote Walsh better
Rio Lobo is OK, but Monty Walsh is awesome.
